reviews.review_msg: I dislike this course because of the prof. He is friendly and easy to approach. In his tutorial, he glazes chatGPT a lot. We had weekly quizzes from readings. Final exam was very long. I received no feedbacks from my assignment, and the professor is disorganized. Some parts of his rubric are weird. Take a STATS course if you want to learn more.

He is very approachable, knowledgeable, passionate, and kind. Show up to class, do the weekly reading, and study the materials he focuses on, then you would do great and enjoy it, as he brings many valuable and applicable real examples. I'm surprised to see the low ratings; they are from students with non-analytical background. I recommend him 100%

The prof is hard to follow and lacks effective teaching skills. Group work consists of weekly tutorial assignments (just 2 or 3 days to complete), a presentation, and a heavy end of sem assignment. Plus, there are weekly quizzes. Very time-consuming for just 3 credits. Avoid this prof if you can but all profs seem not great for this course.

Took Miremad for 343 & now again for 445. It's clear how passionate he is about analytics b/c he is so enthusiastic about his 445 class, it's really great to see. Passionate about what he's teaching, so it's easy to ask him questions. He is a great guy & professor, but the nature of the course and concepts can be difficult to some students
Very hard to follow during the lecture. Doesn't give lots of time for tutorial assignments. Unnecessary stressful class, avoid this professor.
Good prof, lots of group work, criteria is vague but within the bounds of learnt material
The course workload is high, but the professor tried to explain the topics in simple ways. I learned a lot in this course.
Miremad is caring and he was always available when I needed help or clarification. The course topics have been challenging for me, but he explained the topics very well which makes it easier.

Professor is responsive and caring.
The course wasn't difficult. Readings were straightforward. Weekly exercises were fair amount of work. Group projects had far more students than needed.
Guess people didn't like him majorly since his lectures weren't helpful but repeating what's been assigned to read. But I deem it as consolidation of knowledge.

Oh man, name me a worse prof at Beedie than Miremad. Yes, he is very passionate, very enthusiastic, very knowledgeable, but doesn't know how to teach AT ALL. BUS445 on its own is not a hard subject, but the way he delivers the lectures and materials made everyone confused. Avoid if you have any other options.
